docs.snippet: A trial opened in Lithuania on Wednesday against dozens of former Soviet military officials accused of war crimes and crimes against humanity in a 1991 crackdown against the Baltic state's pro-independence movement....
docs.lead_paragraph: A trial opened in Lithuania on Wednesday against dozens of former Soviet military officials accused of war crimes and crimes against humanity in a 1991 crackdown against the Baltic state's pro-independence movement.

headline.main: Lithuania Opens Trial of Ex-Soviet Military Officers Over 1991 Killings
headline.print_headline: Lithuania Opens Trial of Ex-Soviet Military Officers Over 1991 Killings

docs.snippet: Syrian refugees should be given an opportunity to cast their ballots in the country's future elections, Russia's security chief has told The Associated Press, adding that the international community should focus on creating conditions for a free v...
docs.lead_paragraph: Syrian refugees should be given an opportunity to cast their ballots in the country's future elections, Russia's security chief has told The Associated Press, adding that the international community should focus on creating conditions for a free vote in Syria.

headline.main: AP Exclusive: Putin Aide: Syrian Vote Must Include Refugees
headline.print_headline: AP Exclusive: Putin Aide: Syrian Vote Must Include Refugees

docs.snippet: Syrian Kurdish officials will not be invited to peace talks in Geneva, where negotiations for the opposition will be led by a Saudi-backed opposition group, France's foreign minister said on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Syrian Kurdish officials will not be invited to peace talks in Geneva, where negotiations for the opposition will be led by a Saudi-backed opposition group, France's foreign minister said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Kurds Won't Attend Syria Talks, Saudi-Backed Opponents to Take Lead-Fabius
headline.print_headline: Kurds Won't Attend Syria Talks, Saudi-Backed Opponents to Take Lead-Fabius

docs.snippet: Kiev has failed to meet its obligations under the Minsk peace accord and has instead introduced an economic blockade of eastern Ukraine, Russia's security chief says....
docs.lead_paragraph: Kiev has failed to meet its obligations under the Minsk peace accord and has instead introduced an economic blockade of eastern Ukraine, Russia's security chief says.

headline.main: AP Exclusive: Putin Aide: Kiev Refuses to Honor Minsk Deal
headline.print_headline: AP Exclusive: Putin Aide: Kiev Refuses to Honor Minsk Deal

docs.snippet: International Criminal Court judges have authorized an investigation into war crimes and crimes against humanity allegedly committed during the brief 2008 conflict in the former Soviet republic of Georgia. The investigation is the first full-scale...
docs.lead_paragraph: International Criminal Court judges have authorized an investigation into war crimes and crimes against humanity allegedly committed during the brief 2008 conflict in the former Soviet republic of Georgia. The investigation is the first full-scale case for ICC prosecutors outside Africa.

headline.main: ICC Judges Authorize Investigation Into Georgia's 2008 War
headline.print_headline: ICC Judges Authorize Investigation Into Georgia's 2008 War

docs.snippet: Germany is cautioning Russia against using the mysterious disappearance of a 13-year-old German-Russian girl in Berlin for political purposes....
docs.lead_paragraph: Germany is cautioning Russia against using the mysterious disappearance of a 13-year-old German-Russian girl in Berlin for political purposes.

headline.main: Case of Girl's Disappearance Stokes German-Russian Tension
headline.print_headline: Case of Girl's Disappearance Stokes German-Russian Tension

docs.snippet: A mass trial has started in Lithuania against 65 former Soviet officials charged with war crimes, crimes against humanity and other offenses for their roles in a violent crackdown on the Baltic country's quest for independence in 1991....
docs.lead_paragraph: A mass trial has started in Lithuania against 65 former Soviet officials charged with war crimes, crimes against humanity and other offenses for their roles in a violent crackdown on the Baltic country's quest for independence in 1991.

headline.main: Lithuania Opens Mass Trial for 1991 Soviet Crackdown
headline.print_headline: Lithuania Opens Mass Trial for 1991 Soviet Crackdown

docs.snippet: Syria's opposition adjourned a meeting in Riyadh on Wednesday without deciding whether to attend peace talks in Geneva planned for Friday, saying it was waiting for a U.N. response to its demands....
docs.lead_paragraph: Syria's opposition adjourned a meeting in Riyadh on Wednesday without deciding whether to attend peace talks in Geneva planned for Friday, saying it was waiting for a U.N. response to its demands.

headline.main: Syrian Opposition Awaits U.N. Response Before Decision to Attend Talks
headline.print_headline: Syrian Opposition Awaits U.N. Response Before Decision to Attend Talks

docs.snippet: Russian officials have decided they should talk to Saudi Arabia and other OPEC countries about output cuts to bolster oil prices, the head of Russia's pipeline monopoly said on Wednesday, remarks that helped spur a sharp rise in world prices....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russian officials have decided they should talk to Saudi Arabia and other OPEC countries about output cuts to bolster oil prices, the head of Russia's pipeline monopoly said on Wednesday, remarks that helped spur a sharp rise in world prices.

headline.main: Russians Want to Talk to OPEC About Output, Pipeline Chief Says
headline.print_headline: Russians Want to Talk to OPEC About Output, Pipeline Chief Says

docs.snippet: The German government on Wednesday banned a far-right Internet platform that it accused of spreading "racist, xenophobic, anti-Semitic, homophobic and anti-Islamic content," and federal prosecutors said two people were arrested....
docs.lead_paragraph: The German government on Wednesday banned a far-right Internet platform that it accused of spreading "racist, xenophobic, anti-Semitic, homophobic and anti-Islamic content," and federal prosecutors said two people were arrested.

headline.main: Germany Bans Far-Right Internet Platform, Arrests 2
headline.print_headline: Germany Bans Far-Right Internet Platform, Arrests 2
